Class AlgorithmExecution

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Boolean,java.lang.Boolean>
      • AlgorithmExecution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Boolean>

    public class AlgorithmExecution
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Boolean,java.lang.Boolean>
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This Class is an extension of the Class SwingWorker which implements the Class Runnable The aim of this class object is fill the arrays (passed as reference) with data and sort them in ascending order with different algorithms including Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Merge Sort and Quick Sort.
    Since:
    5 January 2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Michael Piccoli - 12099662
    See Also:
    SwingWorker, Thread, Runnable, ArrayList

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlgorithmExecution

        public AlgorithmExecution(char sel,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> result,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long>> times)
        This is the Constructor with parameters that allows the user to sort the data with a single sorting algorithm, selected by the user
        Parameters:
        sel - This selects the algorithm which will be used to sort the data
        list - This contains the reference of the array list arrayData that will be filled with unsorted data
        result - This contains the reference of the array list arraySorted, which will be used to save the sorted data
        times - This contains the reference of the array list timeStore where the sorting times will be stored

      • AlgorithmExecution

        public AlgorithmExecution(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> result,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long>> times,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> ar)
        This is the Constructor with parameters that allows the user to sort the data with all sorting algorithms
        Parameters:
        list - This contains the reference of the array list arrayData that will be filled with unsorted data
        result - This contains the reference of the array list arraySorted, which will be used to save the sorted data
        times - This contains the reference of the array list timeStore where the sorting times will be stored
        ar - This contains the reference of the array list arrayStorage which will save all the array with different sizes, created during the execution

        This method starts the merge sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        numbers - This contains the sub array to sort
        left - This is the index of where the new sub-array starts
        right - This is the index of where the new su-array ends

      • mergeSort

        private void mergeSort(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> data,
                       int left,
                       int mid,
                       int right)
        This method sorts the elements in the array using the merge sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        data - This contains the array to sort
        left - This is the index of where the sub-array starts
        mid - This is the index of the middle value in the sub-array
        right - This is the index of where the sub-array ends
